alert.note: Alert for Kittson (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:26PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Twin Valley affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Two Rivers River near Hallock. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 806.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Storm sewers start backing up. Storm sewer valve at TH175 bridge closed. Lift pump inspected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 799.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 805.5 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 802.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
